entries.title: Menopause: Busting the most common myths
entries.description: Every woman will experience menopause, but how much do we really know about it?

entries.title: Thunberg: I don't want to go into politics
entries.description: The teenage activist says the world of politics is toxic and she never intended being the face of a global movement.

entries.title: Analysis: Liz Truss asks to be given more time
entries.description: Few Tory MPs think she should lead them into an election but they are trying to work out their next move.

entries.title: Kevin Spacey denies sex abuse claim during testimony at his trial
entries.description: The actor is on trial in New York over an allegation he touched a 14-year-old boy at a party in 1986.

entries.title: Train strikes: Workers vote on further six months of walkouts
entries.description: The RMT union is asking members if they will support further train strikes to Spring 2023.

entries.title: Germany extends nuclear power amid energy crisis
entries.description: Russia's disruption of energy supplies scuppers Germany's plan to exit nuclear power this year.

entries.title: Ex-UK pilots lured to help Chinese military, MoD says
entries.description: Up to 30 former UK military pilots are thought to have gone to train members of China's Army.

entries.title: The Papers: 'Hunt takes charge' in 'astounding' U-turn on tax
entries.description: The chancellor's new economic plan and the future of the PM leads most of the papers.

entries.title: Emiliano Sala: 'A tragic plane crash; a stain on football's reputation'
entries.description: Emiliano Sala's plane crash death shocked the football world. We've since learned the extent to which that world shaped his path.

entries.title: Millions of people should be paying less for their broadband
entries.description: Providers are failing to promote the cheapest tariffs available for pensioners and people on benefits.

entries.title: Rent increases: What you can do about a rise from your landlord
entries.description: The BBC's Lora Jones tells you four things you can do, if your landlord asks for more money.

entries.title: How Iran state TV tries to control story of protests
entries.description: Iran's state-run media puts forward a very different narrative of the protests from what is being shared on social media.

entries.title: Ukraine prisoner of war: 'I ask God that he doesn't get tortured'
entries.description: The family of Leonid Yevseyev, a Ukrainian prisoner of war, still hope for his safe return.

entries.title: I'll lead Tories into next election, says embattled Liz Truss
entries.description: The PM apologises for mistakes, after her chancellor tears up almost all of her tax-cutting agenda.

entries.title: Booker Prize 2022: Sri Lankan author Shehan Karunatilaka wins with supernatural satire
entries.description: The prestigious book prize is won by Shehan Karunatilaka, for his novel The Seven Moons of Maali.

entries.title: Ballon d'Or: Karim Benzema wins award as best player in world football for first time
entries.description: Real Madrid and France forward Karim Benzema wins the Ballon d'Or - awarded to the best footballer of the year - for the first time.

entries.title: Rugby League World Cup: France 34-12 Greece - Les Bleus beat debutants
entries.description: France secure a 34-12 victory as Greece make their Rugby League World Cup debut in Doncaster on Monday.

entries.title: Ballon d'Or: Real Madrid's Karim Benzema proud of journey to winning award
entries.description: Watch as Real Madrid's Karim Benzema wins the 2022 Ballon d'Or, becoming the first French player to win the trophy since Zinedine Zidane in 1998.

entries.title: Glastonbury 2023: Tickets for festival rise to £340
entries.description: Prices for the world-famous festival have risen by £70, organisers have confirmed.

entries.title: Rugby League World Cup: Greece score first ever World Cup try
entries.description: Watch the moment Siteni Taukamo scores Greece's first try in their first World Cup match against France at the Eco-Power Stadium, Doncaster.

entries.title: Women's Ballon d'Or: Alexia Putellas wins award for being best female footballer in 2022
entries.description: Barcelona captain Alexia Putellas has retained the Women's Ballon d'Or, awarded to the best best female footballer of 2022.

entries.title: Another whirlwind day for politics... in 60 seconds
entries.description: As more radical policy ideas were blitzed by the new chancellor, PM Liz Truss kept a low profile.

entries.title: Warning of 'scary' spending cuts after tax U-turns
entries.description: New chancellor Jeremy Hunt said "almost all" of the tax cuts announced by his predecessor will go.

entries.title: BBC 100: Lenny Henry on Una Marson’s faded legacy
entries.description: Sir Lenny Henry reflects on the extraordinary life of the writer, BBC producer and presenter Una Marson.

entries.title: Liz Truss: How might Tory MPs get rid of the prime minister?
entries.description: As Liz Truss's political future hangs in the balance, Tory MPs are plotting ways to oust her.

entries.title: Plan to remove bankers' bonus cap to go ahead
entries.description: Jeremy Hunt dismantled much of the mini-budget, but will still be scrapping the cap on bankers' bonuses.

entries.title: Russian tower block in flames as aircraft crashes
entries.description: A military plane went down on or near a multi-storey building in the southern town of Yeysk.

entries.title: Kanye West agrees to buy right-wing platform Parler
entries.description: Ye "will never have to fear being removed from social media again", Parler boss George Farmer posts.

entries.title: Fuel protests in more than 90 countries, BBC analysis
entries.description: People are protesting around the world against food and petrol price rises, BBC research finds.

entries.title: Nicola Sturgeon's plan for an independent Scotland
entries.description: Nicola Sturgeon has set out her proposals for currency, borders and debt in an independent Scotland.

entries.title: King Charles meets refugees in Aberdeen
entries.description: The monarch met a family from Afghanistan given a new home by a woman moved by their plight.

entries.title: NFL: Patrick Mahomes, Josh Allen, Ja'Marr Chase make plays of the week
entries.description: Watch Kansas City Chiefs' quarterback Patrick Mahomes stylishly evade contact to throw for a touchdown, plus the rest of the plays of the week from the NFL.

entries.title: Headless body found with Bible quote and rope, jury hears
entries.description: Mee Kuen Chong's body was also found with rope in her handbag, the trial of her alleged killer hears.

entries.title: Lucy Letby trial: Nurse injected air into baby who died, trial told
entries.description: A mother of twins pleaded "don't let my baby die", the jury at Lucy Letby's murder trial hears.

entries.title: Women's Super League: Best goals including Yui Hasegawa's low shot stunner
entries.description: Watch the best goals from the latest round of the Women's Super League, including Yui Hasegawa who scored her first goal for Manchester City with an excellent low shot.

entries.title: Wasps: Premiership club follow Worcester Warriors into administration
entries.description: Wasps make 167 redundancies as they follow Worcester Warriors as the second Premiership club in three weeks to go into administration.

entries.title: Everton woman who stabbed boyfriend to death is jailed
entries.description: Emma Walsh struck her partner with a fatal stab wound to the chest in a row at their Liverpool home.

entries.title: Lutfunisa Kwandwalla: Dead cult member to have Kenya autopsy
entries.description: British citizen Lutfunisa Kwandwalla was found dead at the home of a spiritual leader in Kenya.

entries.title: Venezuela crisis: 7.1m leave country since 2015
entries.description: Venezuelans leave their homeland in droves - even though many struggle to feed themselves abroad.

entries.title: Eurovision: Montenegro and North Macedonia pull out of Liverpool contest
entries.description: Some countries faced increased participation fees following Russia's ban in the song contest.

entries.title: The Crown: Netflix defends show after Sir John Major criticism
entries.description: Former PM Sir John Major had described upcoming scenes in the royals series as 'malicious nonsense'.

entries.title: 'Liz Truss the Brief?' World reacts to UK political turmoil
entries.description: The UK's political chaos has been watched around the world - and commentators haven't held back.

entries.title: T20 World Cup: Scotland beat West Indies but now need another win
entries.description: Stunning two-time T20 world champions West Indies is one of the greatest moments in Scottish cricket - but the team's task has only just begun.

entries.title: Jonathan Dowdall: Ex-Sinn Féin councillor jailed for facilitating murder
entries.description: Ex-Sinn Féin councillor Jonathan Dowdall has been sentenced to four years in prison.

entries.title: T20 World Cup: England beat Pakistan in final warm-up game
entries.description: Ben Stokes shows glimpses of a return to form as England thrash Pakistan by six wickets in their final warm-up game before the T20 World Cup.

entries.title: BBC's Dharshini David: I've never seen anything like this
entries.description: The BBC's Dharshini David says she hasn't seen anything like this in 20 years of covering the economy.

entries.title: Red Bull budget cap breach 'constitutes cheating' - McLaren boss Zak Brown
entries.description: McLaren boss Zak Brown writes a letter to F1's governing body saying Red Bull breaking the budget cap "constitutes cheating".

entries.title: Iraqi minister admits gas flaring cancer link
entries.description: An Iraqi minister tells the BBC that air pollution from oil fields is a major health problem.

entries.title: Uefa's organisation of Champions League final a failure, panel finds
entries.description: Only fans' calm behaviour prevented tragedy at the Champions League final, independent experts say.

entries.title: Jeremy Hunt: We will reverse almost all mini-budget tax cuts
entries.description: Support for household and business energy bills beyond April will also be reviewed, chancellor announces.

entries.title: Energy bill help to be cut from April, says Jeremy Hunt
entries.description: Promise to cap household bills for two years will now be scaled back, says Chancellor Jeremy Hunt.

entries.title: How are kamikaze drones being used by Russia and Ukraine?
entries.description: Russia is using Iranian-made kamikaze drones in attacks on Kyiv and other Ukrainian cities

entries.title: Anti-Bird flu measures in place across Great Britain
entries.description: Bird keepers in England, Scotland and Wales must implement biosecurity measures, the government says

entries.title: Henry Slade left out of England squad for autumn internationals
entries.description: England head coach Eddie Jones leaves Henry Slade out of his squad for the autumn internationals.

entries.title: What Jeremy Hunt's statement means for you
entries.description: The new chancellor has outlined a host of policy changes. This is how is affects your finances.

entries.title: Watch the chancellor's speech in full
entries.description: The chancellor confirms in an emergency statement that plans to cut corporation tax won't go ahead.

entries.title: BTS: K-pop stars to take time out for military service
entries.description: There's been debate for years over whether the world's biggest boy band could be exempt from serving.

entries.title: Mason Greenwood appears in court over attempted rape charge
entries.description: Manchester United player Mason Greenwood is also charged with assault and controlling behaviour.

entries.title: Jurgen Klopp red card among incidents prompting referee charity to call for inquiry into managers
entries.description: A leading referees' charity calls for an inquiry into the touchline behaviour of managers after ugly scenes at Premier League matches.

entries.title: T20 World Cup: Scotland shock West Indies in Group B
entries.description: Scotland, ranked 15th in the world, start their T20 World Cup campaign in brilliant fashion with a shock victory over West Indies.

entries.title: Unification Church: Japan to investigate religious group after Abe killing
entries.description: Ex-leader Shinzo Abe's suspected killer accused him of links with the Unification Church.

entries.title: T20 World Cup: Scotland shock West Indies in Hobart
entries.description: Scotland, ranked 15th in the world, start their Men's T20 World Cup campaign in brilliant fashion by shocking two-time winners West Indies.

entries.title: Pressure mounts on Liz Truss ahead of Jeremy Hunt statement
entries.description: New Chancellor Jeremy Hunt is expected to U-turn on more of the government's tax-cutting plans later.

entries.title: Booker Prize 2022: Queen Consort to award prestigious prize
entries.description: The oldest author ever nominated - 88-year-old Alan Garner - is one of six novelists in the running.

entries.title: Chancellor Jeremy Hunt to fast-track tax and spending measures
entries.description: The move is designed to help reassure jittery markets before they open in London this morning.

entries.title: Met officer faced 11 misconduct allegations
entries.description: The case is highlighted in a review revealing misogyny, racism and sexual misconduct in the force.

entries.title: Watch: Hong Kong protester beaten up in China consulate grounds
entries.description: The man was pulled into the Chinese consulate grounds in Manchester and beaten up.

entries.title: Iga Swiatek beats Donna Vekic to win San Diego Open
entries.description: World number one Iga Swiatek wins her eighth title of 2022 by beating Donna Vekic in the final of the San Diego Open.

entries.title: Dartford Crossing closure: Two people climb up QE2 Bridge
entries.description: There is queuing traffic on the M25 in both directions after police closed the bridge.

entries.title: Rugby League World Cup: Greece's incredible journey to World Cup debut
entries.description: Greece had to overcome a ban on hosting international games to reach the Rugby League World Cup for the first time - even playing in secret in the Athens mountains to avoid detection by police.

entries.title: Woman, 33, charged with murder of Tony Browne in Belfast
entries.description: Tony Browne, who was 54, was stabbed at a property in Poleglass on Friday night.

entries.title: Independence economy would 'work for everyone' - Sturgeon
entries.description: The first minister is publishing a paper on the economic case for Scotland becoming an independent nation.

entries.title: Ukraine war: Multiple explosions in Kyiv as Ukraine reports kamikaze drone strikes
entries.description: Several explosions were heard in the city on Monday, one week after a barrage of Russian strikes on Ukraine.

entries.title: Hong Kong protester dragged into Manchester Chinese consulate grounds and beaten up
entries.description: Clashes broke out after unidentified men attacked placards at a Hong Kong pro-democracy protest.

entries.title: Pound moves higher in Asia trade after U-turns
entries.description: The British currency gained 0.5% against the US dollar in early Asia trading on Monday.

entries.title: How long can Liz Truss survive as prime minister?
entries.description: It's possible the appointment of Mr Hunt will buy the PM some time. But will it be enough?

entries.title: The Papers: 'Game is up' for Truss and 'Met failings' exposed
entries.description: A review finds hundreds of Met Police officers are getting away with breaking the law and misconduct.

entries.title: Al Jazeera staff allege harassment and bullying went unchecked
entries.description: A BBC investigation has found multiple allegations of sexual harassment and bullying at the international broadcaster.
